page.title: 17Schools in the Binstead area
page.content: There is one{primary school}in the village of{Binstead.}It is a modern building in an elevated position at the top of{Hazelmere Avenue.}It was {built in 1971}and was opened on the 27th April of that year. The old, original school, built in 1864 still stands but is now 3 maisonettes. The exterior stone walls made from stone from the local {"Pitts"}are still as they were when the building was a school. The only other school in the area was{Havenstreet School.}It was{closed {down in July 1970}and the building, on the main street of the village, is now used as a community centre. {Binstead School}still maintains the old tradition of the{maypole}at Midsummer. There is a procession of the{May Queen}and each class performs a dance- traditional or contemporary.
